Material used.Description: Human neuroblastoma, SH-SY5Y cells purchased from ATCC were cultured in Minimum Essential Medium.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutants showed significantly lower cell viability following 0.50 µM and 1.00 μΜ rotenone treatment (p < 0.05).
A53T mutants showed significantly lower cell viability following 0.50 µM and 1.00 μΜ rotenone treatment (p < 0.05).
E46K mutants showed significantly lower cell viability following 0.50 µM and 1.00 μΜ rotenone treatment (p < 0.05).
Cell expressing a-Syn A30P and A53T mutants under chronic maneb treatment had significantly lower cell viability than untransfected control (p < 0.05).
Cell expressing a-Syn A30P and A53T mutants under chronic maneb treatment had significantly lower cell viability than untransfected control (p < 0.05).

Basic positive control.Description: Untreated untransfected cells served as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Data were expressed as means ± S.E.M. Statistical analysis was performed using one-way-ANOVA.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability similar to untreated untransfected SH-SY5Y cells

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell viability significantly lower than untreated untransfected SH-SY5Y cells (p < 0.05)

Material used.Description: Cells were harvested and lysed in lysis buffer (10 mM Tris/HCl, pH 7.8, 100 mM NaCl, 0.5% (w/v) sodium deoxycholate, 0.05% (v/v) nonidet-P40, 10 mM EDTA, 0.1 mM PMSF).

Readout description.Result Description: Strong expression of a single 19 kDa a-Syn band in SH-SY5Y cells stably transfected with wt or mutant a-Syn.
Strong expression of a single 19 kDa a-Syn band in SH-SY5Y cells stably transfected with wt or mutant a-Syn.
Strong expression of a single 19 kDa a-Syn band in SH-SY5Y cells stably transfected with wt or mutant a-Syn.

Basic positive control.Description: Lysates were probed with primary antibodies, anti-a-Syn, clone 7B12.2 (Chemicon; 1:1000 dilution).

Basic negative control.Description: Lysates were probed with primary antibodies anti-actin, clone C4 (Millipore).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Presence of a band corresponding to a-synuclein.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Absence or altered size of a-synuclein band.

Material used.Description: For immunofluorescence microscopy, cells were seeded onto coverslips and grown to 50%, fixed with 4% (w/v) paraformaldehyde (Sigma-Aldrich) and permeabilized with 0.5% Triton X-100.

Readout description.Result Description: Evenly distributed bright fluorescence staining in immunofluorescence microscopy of SH-SY5Y cells stably transfected with mutant a-Syn.
Evenly distributed bright fluorescence staining in immunofluorescence microscopy of SH-SY5Y cells stably transfected with mutant a-Syn.
Evenly distributed bright fluorescence staining in immunofluorescence microscopy of SH-SY5Y cells stably transfected with mutant a-Syn.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells were then blocked with 2% goat serum (Sigma-Aldrich), incubated with primary antibody, anti-a-Syn clone 7B12.2 (Chemicon; 1:100 dilution).

Basic negative control.Description: There was weak immunoreactivity in untransfected and mock-transfected cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Absence of staining or abnormal distribution

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Measurement of intracellular H2O2 level and mitochondrial membrane potential

Material used.Description: To evaluate intracellular H2O2 level and mitochondrial membrane potential (m), cells were seeded into 6-well plates

Readout description.Result Description: Cells expressing A30P had significantly greater percentage with disrupted Ym compared to control-under acute maneb, chronic maneb, chronic rotenone + H2O2 or chronic maneb + H2O2.
For A53T percentage of cells with disrupted Im was significantly greater than that of control, following treatment with all the toxic insults.
For E46K percentage of cells with disrupted Im was significantly greater than that of control, following treatment with all the toxic insults.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells were then stained with 5 μΜ 2', 7'-dichlorfluor-escein-diacetate (DCFH-DA; Sigma-Aldrich) for 30 min at 37 °C or with 40 nM 3, 3'-dihexyloxacarbocyanine iodide (DiOC6(3); Sigma-Aldrich) for 15 min at 37 °C
